text: Draft. Very solid, semi sweet, well-balanced, refreshing, decent finish. ..

12 ounce bottle from Shorts. Hazy straw yellow, thin fizzy white head, fair retention. Aroma of sweet apple, pear, and a bit of earth. The taste is sweet apples, some brown sugar, pear, a hint of vanilla. Medium bodied, high carbonation.
Bottled. Really delicate aromas of pear with the apple. Not too sweet or tart.

Refrigerated 12-oz. aluminum can from FlandersNed poured into a glass. Slightly hazy golden with small white head. Aroma is rich Apple, medium body, lower carbonation, and litttle lacing. Taste is rich Apple and some tart Apple. Really nice cider.

Clear brilliant golden under a thin ring of white foam. Bright and sweet apple nose like good ol woodchuck. Crisp and lasting apple sweetness on the flavor thats not too sugary, and doesnt have an obnoxious champagne yeast tone throughout. Just a plain and medium-sweet apple cider. No fuss.
Bottle. Sour milk, apple, pear, and hay aroma. Golden yellow with moderate head. Moderately sweet apple juice/pear and mildly bitter hay flavor. Light tart apple finish. Very pleasant.
Pours a pale golden yellow with a foamy white head that slowly dissipates. Aroma and flavor are apple. A little bit sweet and crisp. Good.

This draft Cider from a beer bar poured a very small sized head of foamy finely sized white colored bubbles that were very quickly diminishing and left behind a uncarbonated transparent weak yellow white colored body and a fair lacing. The mild aroma was green apple. The crisp mouth feel was tingly at the start and at the finish with a medium fruity aftertaste. The mild flavor contained notes of green apple. A decent one that I would consider drinking again.

This is kind of an adult version of Woodchuck or whatever soda pop cider you might come across. Its still a bit sweet but at a more subtle level, carbonation is high and there is a bit of the complexity you get out of actual fermented apple juice. There is a touch of smokiness from the yeast, some floral notes and a bit of white grape. It finishes clean and crisp w/ just a touch of tartness. I reckon this is a pretty reasonable thing to drink.

Sample at Crafted & Cured. Clear pale golden color with a thin white head that evaporates steadily to an outer ring. Short stringy lacing on the glass. Aroma of apples and spice. Medium body with a sweet-tart apple character with some spice and yeast in the background. The finish is semi-dry with an apple cider aftertaste. Decent overall.
This is semi-dry. Very clean and refreshing. There isnt a lot going on with the flavor, more at understated. Super easy drinking. Nice body.
Aroma is apple juice and sweetness. The flavor is apples, fruit, slightly apple-wine like and a mix of tart and slightly sweet finish.

Pours clear golden yellow with no real head. The aroma has rich apples, light rustic notes, apple crisp crust and some tartness. It has a medium crisp body with light carbonation. The taste has rustic apples, light sweetness, spice and some woodiness. The finish is bright and lightly herbal. Great cider.

Bottle thanks to Lindsay and Conner! Pours a clear pee like gold with visible carboniation and a thin white head that dissipates nearly completely. Aroma has a good amount of earthy apple with a sweet apple juice note supporting. Flavor has a good amount of sweet apple with a slight acid bite and a hint of earthiness.
This is a nice cider. Apples in the nose and flavor. A little tart. Dry finish, no alcohol. Pretty nice.

Bottle. Poured clear light amber color with a minimal head that diminished slowly with fair legs. Medium fruit sweet apple aroma. Medium body with a smooth texture and soft legs. Medium sweet apple flavor with a medium sweet finish of moderate duration. Good drinkable beverage.
355ml bottle. Darker cider pour, aroma is earthy and appley. Flavor has some sweetness, very clean and chuggable, hint of phenols, floral, not very tart, very mellow and easy-drinking. Pretty good.
bottle. Pale golden with small head. Tart, juicy apple. Not super complex, but whats there is very nice. Dry finish.
Decent apple aroma and taste. Clear straw color. Some sweetness. No head. ABV at 6.3% is higher than most area ciders.

Pours an interesting orange yellow color. A crisp juicy green apple scent. Big apple juice taste with a tart tongue tingle. Perfect carbonation. A very natural cider all around flavors. Very drinkable and quenching. Very solid stuff.
Bottle. Color is crisp clear orange. Big fresh apple aroma. Taste is crisp tangy slight sweet. Like drinking fresh apple juice.

Pour on tap at One Eyed Bettys, clear golden orange pour with white head, aroma brought notes of apple skin, green apple, pear, peach some slight spice into a bit of lemon. Taste was a nice mix of tart apple, apple skin, some pear into a bit of yeast, some pear, peach notes, finishing slightly tart, slightly sweet.
On tap at ChinnChinn- light but lively carbonation. Great caramel color. Faint applely scent. Very good apple taste. Great combination of sweet and dry.

UPDATED: SEP 24, 2015 Tap at The Oak. Im terrible at reviewing ciders. All I know is that I really like this. Mild sweetness which is perfect. Tastes like hard apple juice but with a much milder sweetness, and low tartness. Best non barrel aged cider Ive had. Very good.
UPDATED: MAY 11, 2016 On tap at the brewpub. Nice golden pour with a fruity apple/pear aroma. Tart sweetness in the taste with a dry finish. Nice.
